intro: Llerasia caucana, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky soils and mountainous regions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The flowers are blue to purple in color and bloom during the cooler months, attracting various pollinators.
